meanings.sent1: The desert sand was parched under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent2: After hours in the sun, the soil became parched and cracked.
meanings.sent3: The poor cactus looked parched, like it had been forgotten to water for weeks.
meanings.sent4: The old wooden door was so parched that it creaked with every movement.
meanings.sent5: Her lips were as parched as the dry, cracked earth in the summer heat.

meanings.sent1: The hiker felt parched after climbing the steep mountain.
meanings.sent2: The travelers were parched after walking for miles in the hot sun.
meanings.sent3: The cat stared at the dripping faucet, looking parched for a drink.
meanings.sent4: His throat felt as parched as a desert when he realized he forgot his water bottle.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the cool, clear stream made her feel even more parched.
